title: Are Hotels Required to Accept Pets During Natural Disasters?
subtitle: Neither FEMA nor the 2006 PETS law requires hotels and motels to accommodate pets during emergencies.
author: Kim LaCapria
vclaim: The federal government, either through the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) or the 2006 PETS law allows pet owners to bring their pets to any hotel or motel during weather-related evacuations.
